result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Thomas M. Bychinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any week not  defendant must complete 5 hours community service per week.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:50pm
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person and with Atty John Wallace.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW; Waiver of Prelim. filed.
  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.

State moves to:
Ct. 3 (Obstructing)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Burglary/Bldg/PTAC)>>GUILTY
Ct. 2 (Theft/Property/PTAC)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty on Ct. 2 only.

COURT ORDERS: Ct. 2>>Sentence W/held; 1 year probation
CONDITIONS: ANy assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any week not so employe/schooled, defendant must complete 5 hours of c.s. per week.

Ct. 1>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 18 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1
DEOJ RH>> 3/28/16 at 8:30am
Bond continues.

Attorney Wallace requests Ct. 2 be expunged upon successful completion of probation - State objects; COURT will allow defendant to petition for expungement upon completion.

Case called: 9:19am.  Clerk: Denise. State appears by Atty Kyle Mayo. Defendant does not appear for Prelim. Atty John Wallace appears for Defendant. Atty Wallace requests waiver of time limits. Crt addresses Defendant's non appearance. Atty Wallace states communicaiton with Defendant and that defendant will be signing waiver of time limits. Atty Wallace just appointed. Crt will not issue BW based on Atty Wallace's representation. Crt states Defendant MUST be here for all future hearings. DATES: PTC 8/20/14 @ 9:05am. CC: BR 5. Adjourned: 9:20am.
